text:
### 149 / 281 ###

___________________________________________Notes___________________________________________
Expectations: Only discuss shared items where we have dependencies on each other. In the case of possible disagreement,
we follow guidelines discussed last night. Either party can stop the conversation at any time. We treat each other with
dignity and respect and speak as if we were talking to our boss in fear of losing our job.
Mutually Agreed Proposed Agenda
Robert to get a medical spending card- I will call Fidelity tomorrow and try to figure this out.
Robert to contact SAAS Admissions-  You are against KJH at his point. I will write SaaS by EOW to understand the
options.
Robert to install the microwave and furnace- Need to find a way to get Microwave in the AM but need to meet with
Lisa.
Do we need anything for unemployment? CC thoughts?- Christine will pay off a credit card, utilities and see about
others
Robert gets a BofA account, Max check & 3.5k transfer- This may realistically happen next week. This week is
jammed.
Robert's birthday, Max is gone, AD spends with Dad- Assume pick up after school. Back Sat am whenever you say
works.
Christine's Whistler plans for late Jan- Max and AD- I think you said you would like to swap. Happy for you to
propose details.
Next steps for Hoops and Skiing logistics- You will pull together a week-by-week list of conflicts and decision dates
we have.
Comms expectations for us near term- WOW! Tonight worked so let's take the win! Parenting Plan makes all the
difference now.
Robert to keep looking at Eastside places- No, it is not going to be 18k. And we need a budget so you can feel less
anxiety.
Agree on move-out plans timelines
Kirkland Ave- We have a start and you are working on it. You moved my stuff, (I could tell)... lol might as well
go for it now. :P
Alki- I will take the lead and propose a phased approach to getting us out of there. But we will both need to
pitch in.
Robert to Kick off therapy investigations- We agree that I should continue to investigate, share info and keep you
informed.
DBT (both)
Communication counseling (both)
Child Therapy (Max & Adrian)
Substance Use Counseling (robert)
Child-Led Reunification (robert & max)
Robert sent Alki email; our next steps?
Plans for setting a meditation date- I will speak with Lisa to understand landscaping better. We both want to do the
right thing fiscally.
Next steps for Spring Break plans- I still need to consider options. You don't want to do anything with me at all right
now.
National Championship- We did not discuss this but I'm sure AD will bring it up. It is on Monday if that works to let
him join me.

=== Subject: Re: Running List Notes
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
To: Christine Moyer <christinemoyer@hotmail.com>
Date Sent: Saturday, January 6, 2024 3:33:28 PM GMT-08:00
Date Received: Saturday, January 6, 2024 3:33:28 PM GMT-08:00
Last call...

Examples of things I’d discuss today:
Eastside- if I could lease 9 vs 12, should I?
Kitchen- what scanpan set is equivalent?
Towels- do we just do a refresh together?
After three days I assume you have no interest, but we will have to work together for the moves. I thought it might
be easier if we made joint decisions now about our spend instead of after the fact.
All good. No hard feelings. Full steam ahead.
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
Sent: Wednesday, January 3, 2024 11:44:51 PM
To: Chris�ne Moyer <chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com>

I don’t know if you read this or not. It’s tough when we need to do big communications across a broad range of topics.  Its
just not OFW compatible
But, if you share my assessment, and you want to collaborate more, I’d consider that. I’m sure we can make each other
“equally unhappy” as Dr Brown says.
Point being, I learned from her and the exercise. And I’m willing to make some concessions if you are as we consider our
long term fiscal planning.
I’m not going to sell or negotiate in an email, but I have a few ideas (example: my eastside place, 9 vs 12 months?) I want a
year but am open to a conversation.
If we can get to a place where we are on better terms, both feel the pinch sometimes for the greater good in other areas we
might be well served.
And god help us both, as it will require both trust and patience with one another. But anyway, I’m honestly ready to work
with you  for the next four months.
Just a thought....
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
Sent: Wednesday, January 3, 2024 6:45:55 PM
To: Chris�ne Moyer <chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com>
Cc: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>

I have my notes from our call below for you to take a look at. Please let me know if I have missed anything.
I realize it was acrimonious at times. That's to be expected after the last six months of lunacy without a plan and lawyers
driving this. But what you said about the budget, single-income concerns, and planning for the future all make sense. And
hearing that we are both not locking on when we sell the house or allowing the divorce calendar date to drive
irresponsible fiscal decisions was music to my ears.
Even as pissy as we were getting, I know when you are making sense. You are smart as hell. And in these things, yin to my
yang. That is how we have always been so successful and why 50/50 is so fair. I hope I was making some sense, too, and I
want to be sure you have the info and $$$ you need so you are not anxious or feel like you have to bother me for handouts.
That's not the way this should work.
And, now the parenting plan is set for the next four months, we have time to breathe and can actually work together
constructively. All the stuff we fought over is 90% settled. So let's allow the dust to settle, show some grace for two people

who were thrown into a battle they were ill-prepared for and guided by some sketchy intentions, and put that
nonsense behind us. No reason to hang on to that baggage.
We really did make a great team in many ways for 25 years. Let's see what we can accomplish for our closing act...  w
___________________________________________Notes___________________________________________
Expectations: Only discuss shared items where we have dependencies on each other. In the case of possible disagreement,
we follow guidelines discussed last night. Either party can stop the conversation at any time. We treat each other with
dignity and respect and speak as if we were talking to our boss in fear of losing our job.
Mutually Agreed Proposed Agenda
Robert to get a medical spending card- I will call Fidelity tomorrow and try to figure this out.
Robert to contact SAAS Admissions-  You are against KJH at his point. I will write SaaS by EOW to understand the
options.
Robert to install the microwave and furnace- Need to find a way to get Microwave in the AM but need to meet with
Lisa.
Do we need anything for unemployment? CC thoughts?- Christine will pay off a credit card, utilities and see about
others
Robert gets a BofA account, Max check & 3.5k transfer- This may realistically happen next week. This week is
jammed.
Robert's birthday, Max is gone, AD spends with Dad- Assume pick up after school. Back Sat am whenever you say
works.
Christine's Whistler plans for late Jan- Max and AD- I think you said you would like to swap. Happy for you to
propose details.
Next steps for Hoops and Skiing logistics- You will pull together a week-by-week list of conflicts and decision dates
we have.
Comms expectations for us near term- WOW! Tonight worked so let's take the win! Parenting Plan makes all the
difference now.
Robert to keep looking at Eastside places- No, it is not going to be 18k. And we need a budget so you can feel less
anxiety.
Agree on move-out plans timelines
Kirkland Ave- We have a start and you are working on it. You moved my stuff, (I could tell)... lol might as well
go for it now. :P
Alki- I will take the lead and propose a phased approach to getting us out of there. But we will both need to
pitch in.
Robert to Kick off therapy investigations- We agree that I should continue to investigate, share info and keep you
informed.
DBT (both)
Communication counseling (both)
Child Therapy (Max & Adrian)
Substance Use Counseling (robert)
Child-Led Reunification (robert & max)
Robert sent Alki email; our next steps?
Plans for setting a meditation date- I will speak with Lisa to understand landscaping better. We both want to do the
right thing fiscally.
Next steps for Spring Break plans- I still need to consider options. You don't want to do anything with me at all right
now.
National Championship- We did not discuss this but I'm sure AD will bring it up. It is on Monday if that works to let
him join me.

And god help us both, as it will require both trust and patience with one another. But anyway, I’m honestly ready to work

I have my notes from our call below for you to take a look at. Please let me know if I have missed anything.
I realize it was acrimonious at times. That's to be expected after the last six months of lunacy without a plan and lawyers
driving this. But what you said about the budget, single-income concerns, and planning for the future all make sense. And

Even as pissy as we were getting, I know when you are making sense. You are smart as hell. And in these things, yin to my

That's not the way this should work.
And, now the parenting plan is set for the next four months, we have time to breathe and can actually work together

We really did make a great team in many ways for 25 years. Let's see what we can accomplish for our closing act...  w

Next steps for Hoops and Skiing logistics- You will pull together a week-by-week list of conflicts and decision dates
we have.
Comms expectations for us near term- WOW! Tonight worked so let's take the win! Parenting Plan makes all the
difference now.
Robert to keep looking at Eastside places- No, it is not going to be 18k. And we need a budget so you can feel less
anxiety.
Agree on move-out plans timelines
Kirkland Ave- We have a start and you are working on it. You moved my stuff, (I could tell)... lol might as well
go for it now. :P
Alki- I will take the lead and propose a phased approach to getting us out of there. But we will both need to
pitch in.
Robert to Kick off therapy investigations- We agree that I should continue to investigate, share info and keep you
informed.
DBT (both)
Communication counseling (both)
Child Therapy (Max & Adrian)
Substance Use Counseling (robert)
Child-Led Reunification (robert & max)
Robert sent Alki email; our next steps?
Plans for setting a meditation date- I will speak with Lisa to understand landscaping better. We both want to do the

Next steps for Spring Break plans- I still need to consider options. You don't want to do anything with me at all right
now.
National Championship- We did not discuss this but I'm sure AD will bring it up. It is on Monday if that works to let
him join me.

=== Subject: Moyer Family: Course Correction
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
To: Christine Moyer <christinemoyer@hotmail.com>
Cc: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
Date Sent: Thursday, January 4, 2024 2:02:57 PM GMT-08:00
Happy New Year, SAAS Friends!
Hope that you had a wonderful and restful time creating memories with family and friends. I've told anyone who will listen
how much our oldest (Max) has enjoyed his first year as part of your community. Historically, as a big STEM kid, Christine
and I had to make a leap of faith, choosing SAAS over Tesla, and we could not be happier with our decision. Thank you for
doing such a great job meeting him where he is and developing and inspiring new areas of interest!
Batting .500 in baseball is incredible. But if it's your average choosing the right school for your kids, it's awful.
Unfortunately, that's where we find ourselves. We believed in the fall, Adrian would be better suited to another school based
on the STEM program and his best friends attending the same school. After a few months, however, the difference in
experiences is so profound we would like to see if there is any opportunity to have Adrian join the SAAS community.
Naturally, SAAS may be fully booked, and a mid-year transfer may be a pipe dream. It might also be
developmentally inappropriate without the proper care. But Christine and I would love to discuss what SAAS may see as a
possible path to join the community in the near or medium term. This is not a decision we take lightly. Moving from ICS to
SAAS might create new challenges for us. But we would love to discuss if it is even possible and /or appropriate for Adrian.

- best
Christine & Robert

=== Subject: Re: Backcountry Ski Trip Info
From: christine moyer <christinemoyer@hotmail.com>
To: "hleblanc@seattleacademy.org" <hleblanc@seattleacademy.org>,"rob.moyer@gmail.com" <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
Date Sent: Friday, January 5, 2024 12:47:08 PM GMT-08:00
Date Received: Friday, January 5, 2024 12:47:14 PM GMT-08:00
Hi Hannah,
Realizing this email comes very late and we should have realized much sooner, but we just realized we did not arrange to
rent the AVY backpack for Max Moyer for the training this weekend.
Is there an option for us to do so at this time or is there a spare he can access. If yes, we are happy to jump through any
formalities, payments etc to make this happen.
We understand this was a miss on our part and apologize for the late request.
Regards
Christine and Robert

From: Hannah LeBlanc <m@mail2.veracross.com>
Sent: Monday, January 1, 2024 8:41 PM
To: chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com <chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com>

Hi all!
Hope everyone has had a restful break and is getting excited for our AIARE weekend coming up!
If you/your student has any dietary restrictions (including vegetarian, gluten free, etc), please email me back ASAP so
that we can let the folks up at the Mountaineers lodge know for their food planning purposes.
The final gear check is this Wednesday (January 3rd). Please bring everything you will need for the weekend, including
sleeping bag, pillow, headlamp, all ski clothes & lounging clothes. Things you will need between Wednesday and Friday
morning (such as toiletries, medications, your water bottle) can be brought with you on Friday morning in a daypack or
disposable plastic bag to be put in with the rest of your gear.
We will meet at the Spring St. cutout at 6:15am on Friday morning. You do not need to pack a lunch for Friday, however
you should bring some bus snacks/on the go breakfast.
Please let me know if you have any questions and enjoy your final day of break!
-Hannah

=== Subject: From a Legal Perspective
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
To: Christine Moyer <christinemoyer@hotmail.com>
Bcc: rob.moyer@gmail.com
Date Sent: Sunday, January 7, 2024 6:36:29 PM GMT-08:00
Date Received: Sunday, January 7, 2024 6:36:29 PM GMT-08:00
Whenever I say that, you always jump to “so your lawyer told you to XYX...” . I always correct you. Lisa did not tell me
that.  You just don’t seem to grok that.
Newsflash- I’m pretty well versed in both AI and online Q&A legal forums. Between the two platforms, they are great at a
straightforward reading of the law.
I use them all the time to understand hypothetical situations I don’t need to pay $600 an hour for. I always try to educate
myself before I speak and spend money.
So for the last time... probably not... when I say “from a legal perspective” it is just that. But that does not equate to advice
that Lisa has given to me as my counsel.
